file_content.text: Oh... no... please. I confess everything. I beg you, don't!
I'll let you live, maggot.
Don't worry.
Oh, thank you... thank you!
As long as I live, I will be at your beck and call. You will always have an ally here on Alderaan!
I could come back any time.
Expect me.
Whenever you do, I am yours to command.
You will be my Alderaan slave.
Not my ally, my servant.
Just say the word and I will run to do your bidding.
You've given me a new purpose in life. I take my leave of you. Goodbye.
This is our last meeting.
Allow me to make that prediction come true, effective immediately.
Ah, come in! I heard of your success, and I am so very pleased for you.
Cut the antics, Kendoh.
Drop the act.
Is there a problem?
You're my problem.
Yes. I'm looking at it.
Baras told me you called me a traitor and blamed me for the murder of your fellow Thuls.
You slandered me to my master.
You're about to have a very big problem.
There is for you.
You told Baras I murdered your rivals, and you called me a traitor.
I heard about your lies.
I want to show my appreciation for all the help you've provided me.
Thank you for your assistance.
Your thanks are unnecessary. I must confess, I profited substantially from your exploits.
After you left to blow up the power generator, I realized the explosion would leave a few of my Thul rivals defenseless.
So, I positioned assassins at the ready and voila! Your success allowed me to strike my enemies and ascend within the Thul ranks.
Very resourceful.
Smart.
Thank you. I do have my moments.
So, are you here to say goodbye? Or is there something else I can do for you?
You told Baras I killed them.
You blamed me for the murders.
Oh, uh, he... I see--how awkward for me. Allow me to explain.
You manipulated the situation in order to carry out your own objectives.
So, you used me.
I knew my needs wouldn't interfere with yours, so it was a win-win.
And since you have won, I suspect you'll be leaving our fair planet, yes? Is there anything I can do to facilitate you?
Nothing springs to mind.
No.
Well, I suppose that means our time together is at an end. So if you don't mind--
I must speak up. Is that all you're going to do, friend? Leave?
You reaped the fruit of my labor. Pay me.
I need compensation.
I suppose that is in order. I'll wire a healthy sum of credits into your account and bid you goodbye--
Excuse the interruption, friend. You're just going to extort credits from him?
Kendoh used you. He blamed you for his murders and called you a traitor to Darth Baras. Are you going to sit still?
Kendoh is not worth my trouble.
It means nothing.
If you're so offended, you kill him.
Punish him yourself.
When you put it like that, I can't let him slide.
You're right.
Don't put up a fight... and this won't take long.
Yes. You can die.
I... oh. You've spoken with your master, I see. I can explain.
I realized when you blew up the power generator, several of my rivals would be exposed. So, I seized the opportunity to eliminate them.
I... had company when I was speaking with your master, and I needed to keep my fellow house members blind to my maneuvering--
That is a lie. You contacted Baras yourself, alone.
The truth comes out.
A-ha!
You shouldn't make accusations of that kind unless you're certain.
Are you sure about that?
We were attending him at the time. The fool didn't worry about us being present.
Lying to me was your last mistake.
You're about to die, Kendoh.
I--I only wanted Baras to know that I was looking out for him.
It was harmless. I knew you would succeed, and all Baras would care about was that.
Please... please don't... kill me. FimmRess, you and your men are assigned to me. If I am attacked, you must defend.
If Darth Baras's apprentice decides you die, we will not intercede.
Kendoh's going to die, you can count on that.
That is the decision.
It will be a pleasure to be relieved of this assignment. Can we help at all?
I don't need any help.
Just watch. [Kill Kendoh]
No! You're supposed to protect me...!
I want you to kill him, FimmRess.
Do the honors yourself.
I'm going to kill you and your fellows as well.
You can die with him.
But we are Sith, like you. And I told you the truth about Kendoh. Why? Why do you include us in your vengeance?
It's sickening to see Sith subservient to this worthless piece of filth.
For being peons. [Attack]
It would be too easy to merely kill him. I like to challenge myself!
For the thrill of it. [Attack]
We shall end you!
Rid the galaxy of Kendoh or you share his fate.
Fine. Kill him and you live.
As you wish.
You were supposed to protect me...!
He was a sad and twisted waste of space. Serving him was torture.
No one dies today, but he must leave Alderaan forever.
Kendoh will be banished.
And give up everything I... I've worked so hard for?
That is your punishment.
Blame yourself.
A very stiff and painful one.
I'm sure you'll land on your feet.
You'll be fine.
Yes... yes, I will strive to do just that.
The alternative is death. Your choice.
Or I can kill you.
No! It is a most gracious allowance.
I will leave this planet... my home... immediately, a broken man.
Most people who cross me end up dead.
Consider yourself lucky.
I will try to let that sustain me.
You're breaking my heart.
I couldn't care less.
I know there is no sympathy for me....
Taking everything away from you is a fate worse than death.
Good, I want you to suffer.
Yes, if reducing me to despair was your intention, you've succeeded completely.
Goodbye, Sith. I shall never return to this place.
What a sad, pathetic man. Serving him was a daily dose of nausea.
I have no sympathy for you.
I don't care.
To each their own, friend. The Dark Council commanded our service, and we obeyed.
I can imagine.
No doubt.
Consider yourselves set free.
It's over now.
Now we report back to our master on the Council.
We will be paying attention to your exploits. Farewell.
What's done is done. My mission is complete, that's all I care about.
Forget it, let him live.
Some Sith you are. With such a casual attitude, I won't be surprised if Darth Baras's interests in the galaxy go up in smoke.
Do you want to die?
Back off or else.
Some day. But I doubt it would be today.
I'm going to laugh that off. Goodbye.
You amuse me.
Do not turn your back on us.
We gave you respect, but now I see you're all talk.
You've exposed weakness, friend. Weakness must be punished.
I warn you, do not attack me.
Stand down.
Your hesitation is another weakness. Attack!
Come on, I'm ready for you.
Then attack.
I'll punish you first!
Die! [Attack]
Congratulations, today is the last day of your life!
Die for that! [Attack]
You're not ready for this!
To lower the force field that protects Gesselle Organa's headquarters, you'll have to use the explosive I supplied you on the Alderaan power generator.
So, FimmRess tells me the lead was fruitful. Although Lady Renata was not the girl's mistress, she knew who was--Gesselle Organa.
I should say General Gesselle Organa. Now you have to track her down, which poses a bit of a problem.
I haven't met a problem my lightsaber can't solve.
I'm not worried.
Well, let's discover a way to put it to use here, eh?
Explain yourself.
If you can't solve the problem, you should be afraid.
I hope not, for your sake.
Well, I'd better come up with a solution then.
Gesselle Organa leads the Organa war against House Ulgo. Her headquarters is protected by an impenetrable force field. No firepower can breach it.
The forcefield allows Gesselle and her advisors to be stationed very close to the front and maintain a more hands-on command.
Sounds like General Gesselle knows what she's doing.
She's smart.
As smart as she is, there must be a way to overcome... wait... yes!
There's got to be a way to penetrate the force field.
It can't be foolproof.
That is the task that faces us... wait... yes!
I grow impatient for an answer, Kendoh.
You better have a solution.
These things can't be rushed. Unless... yes, wait, I think I have it.
A force field needs power to maintain itself, yes? So, if we manage to cut the power....
And I bet I know exactly where Gesselle is getting her juice. If I'm right, you could just walk through the front door.
Sounds very promising.
I'm optimistic.
Sounds fishy.
I've given you little reason to. I hope to remedy that.
Get to the point.
Almost all power on Alderaan is supplied by the planetary generator. Gesselle must be piggybacking the system to power her force field.
Several of my fellows do this to maintain their special security needs. A precise charge at the generator will force fail-safes to fire.
The planet won't miss a beat, but ancillary systems like Gesselle's forcefield will have to be manually reset. Which could take some time.
And I bang my way inside while the force field is down.
So they'll be defenseless.
Just point me in the right direction.
Tell me where to go.
What do you think of this plan?
Vette, any thoughts?
Me? Wow, you want my opinion. Cool.
I'll tell you, I just don't trust this guy.
What a... charming creature you are. Believe me, this is the only way to gain access to the Organa headquarters.
What's your assessment of the duke's plan, Captain?
Quinn, your thoughts?
It's sound, my lord. If the force field operates on an emergency power tap, when the system transfers to backup sources, the tap will have to be re-engaged.
Your man knows his stuff.
Based on your experience here, does Kendoh's plan make sense?
Are you buying this, FimmRess?
It's smart to scrutinize anything the duke says, but his idea seems sound to me, friend.
Precisely. It is infallible.
FimmRess, fetch a seven-stroke-seven detonator from my arms cabinet there and give it to our friend.
As you wish.
The Alderaan power generator is located above the Straight Valley, and it boasts the planet's most advanced security systems.
You'll have to fight your way in, set the charge, then fight your way out before the boom. It won't be easy.
Are you trying to make me angry?
Don't insult me.
Forgive me. Just seeking to prepare you the best I am able.
Thanks for the heads-up.
I'll try not to yawn too much.
It will be easy.
Once you've detonated the generator, you'll still have to wade through Gesselle's surrounding army and invade her headquarters before her forcefield is reset.
I'll be eagerly tracking your progress. Good luck.
I heard you decided not to allow FimmRess to bring the Lady Renata to me. I am most disappointed.
Don't cry too hard. You'll get over it.
Too bad.
You don't know me very well.
Do your own dirty work.
I'm not your lackey.
There was no more work to be done. You only had to allow my man to take her.
You would have tired of her quickly.
You're better off.
Oh, it would have taken hours. Perhaps days.
By denying my claim to Renata, you certainly aren't providing me much incentive to help you. Where's my motivation?
I suspect self-preservation is incentive enough. Or maybe I should just kill you?
Being allowed to live?
Consider me motivated.
Renata would have been a distraction for you.
I need you focused.
And now you have my full attention, is that it? I see the logic.
You need to become self-motivated, Kendoh.
I'm not here to inspire you.
I prefer self-interested, but I see what you're saying.
Ah, you return. I'm beside myself with appreciation for delivering Lady Renata for me. She will prove to be most... useful.
Anything for House Thul.
My pleasure.
You will forever be cherished here.
Pay me.
Of course. You deserve great compensation.
I couldn't care less.
Just expressing my boundless appreciation.
I believe Lady Renata of House Alde holds the key to finding the family of the Padawan you seek.
As I recall, Darth Baras wanted information on a young Alderaanian girl who was taken off-planet to train with Jedi Master Nomen Karr.
I was to locate her family so that you could, well, send the girl a message.
For your sake, I hope you were successful.
You better have results.
They'll find I'm much more than a messenger.
A painful one.
And you'll need to be. I had difficulty finding even a single lead.
You are correct.
The truth is, information about this girl is difficult to come by. I managed only one lead.
Nomen Karr's Padawan fits the description of the former handmaiden of a noblewoman in House Alde named Lady Renata.
I'd have questioned her already, but Renata is protected by House Alde's greatest champion. The man has never met his match in melee.
He's never met me.
That's about to change.
Sounds like a challenge.
Could be tough.
No doubt about it. The man isn't very bright but he never leaves her side.
I'll be fine.
If I may, once you've eliminated her protector and gotten what you need....
I would be personally very indebted, if you'd arrange to have Lady Renata brought to us. For questioning.
Don't tell me what to do.
I don't work for you.
I apologize if that sounded like a declaration. It was simply a request.
We'll see.
All right. I'll just hope the mood strikes you.
I'll need credits.
Oh, I'll personally see to it if you deliver the fair woman to me. Unscathed.
While House Alde is a small player on Alderaan, it is affiliated with House Organa.
Therefore, Lady Renata's estate is in hostile territory and very well-defended. Be cautious.
Caution is for worms like you.
That's your way, not mine.
I won't argue with you there.
I'll be back soon.
Thank you.
Well, your mission is now my mission. It's supremely important to me that you succeed.
I do hope to see you soon. Until then.
You lack patience, Duke Kendoh. There are standard procedures that must be adhered to.
Your disregard for our family rules is appalling. You are an abomination. Goodbye, cousin!
Fools. They won't be feeling much of anything for long--
Duke Kendoh, Darth Baras sent me.
They are better off than you.
What...? You're not on my schedule. I don't appreciate being interrupted.
Baras isn't even on my radar, Sith. I have a war to wage and personal ambitions to achieve here.
Is breathing one of your personal ambitions?
Do you want to live?
Aiding Baras may help you achieve those ambitions.
We can help each other.
Please, don't try to manipulate me. I have Sith bodyguards of my own now--tell Baras I'm through being his lackey.
FimmRess, show this intruder out. On his feet or his back, makes no difference to me.
FimmRess, escort this intruder away. Kill her if you have to.
I'm here to adjust your radar.
You better change your tune.
A threat? You see these Sith I have attending me? Your corpse will be my message to your master.
FimmRess, make this intruder a distant memory, will you?
I'm sorry, Duke Kendoh, we are assigned to protect you and support your interests in the struggle for Alderaan.
But we serve the Emperor first. And we will not cross Darth Baras, or his apprentice.
It's good to know some people have respect.
Well met.
We consider you an ally, friend.
Do you fear me, Sith?
Are you trembling?
Fear weakens the coward. It's respect that tempers my actions here.
I don't respect a kiss-up.
What a pathetic attempt.
I simply see the big picture. You have our respect and allegiance.
Uh, okay, that was unexpected....
It seems I may have been hasty regarding your master's needs. How can I make amends?
You can start by bowing to me, too.
Submit.
Of course. Consider it a small demonstration of my repentance.
Do your job and all will be well.
Just cooperate.
Don't be afraid. Baras doesn't want you dead. For now.
No amends needed. Just listen.
Then I will endeavor to remain on his good side.
I pledge the same level of focus that had me so absorbed in my own work.
I pledge myself to your directives, and as I aid you, perhaps you'll be moved to help me in mine.
We'll see. Time will tell.
Perhaps.
I am focused and at your service.
I'd say there's a very good chance of that.
Sure.
Then you can consider me extremely motivated.
Unless your directives involve your suicide, I won't be participating.
Don't count on it.
Point taken. I hope time will improve our relations.
You must leave Alderaan and never return.
I banish you.
You brought this on yourself.
Sorry. [Kill Kendoh.]
I don't want it to end...!
Oh. You haven't left Alderaan yet. What a... pleasure. I thought we'd seen the last of you.
I just came to pay my respects one more time.
I wanted to thank you.
Ah. Well, that's very cordial of you. I've benefited greatly from your exploits here, so no further demonstrations are necessary.
Ah, you return triumphant. I heard you succeeded in your search for Jaesa Willsaam's parents. Congratulations.
That mouth of yours keeps getting you into trouble.
Shut up, Kendoh.
Oh? Have I done something wrong?
Don't play innocent.
Drop the act.
You told Baras I was a traitor and tried to pin the murders you committed on me.
You slandered me to my master.
Oh... that. Yes, that was an unfortunate circumstance. I'm... happy to set the record straight.
You've done something fatal!
Your final mistake.
I... am at a loss. Unless... wait, you've spoken with Darth Baras. Please, let me explain.
Baras tells me you called me a traitor and tried to pin your murders on me.
I heard about your lies.
I see. Well... aren't I embarrassed. Please allow me to... explain.
As I told you, when you blew up the power generator, several of my rivals were made vulnerable. So I seized the opportunity.
I want to show my appreciation for all the help you've provided me.
I came to thank you.
No need for thanks. As I said, I have already profited quite well from your exploits.
My new station in this house does keep me very busy of course. So, is there... anything else you require of me?
We have both profited from your success finding Jaesa Willsaam's parents. Feel free to enjoy the party as long as you like.
Linger here at House Thul and enjoy the celebration as long as you like. I'm sure your business finding Jaesa Willsaam's parents will wait.
Ah, you're just in time for the festivities--which is appropriate, as you are the guest of honor.
By knocking out the power generator, not only did you gain access to General Gesselle, but you enabled me to eliminate a few rivals.
I don't appreciate being manipulated, Kendoh.
You used me.
Oh, come now, all I did was seize an opportunity.
Good for you.
Well done.
It was very good for me indeed--and my power within House Thul.
You could have told me your plan.
Why'd you keep that a secret?
Truth is, I didn't realize what a great opportunity it was until after you left.
In order to get to Gesselle, you had to hit the generator. My purpose in no way impeded yours. So, it was a win-win.
In fact, I understand your success is complete. You were able to track down Jaesa Willsaam's parents.
That's right.
Thanks to you.
Glad to have served you.
Don't be nosey.
Understood, and especially true now that your work on Alderaan is done.
I trust you'll be departing soon. Please give Darth Baras my warmest regards.
I will gladly do that.
Sure.
Not in a million years.
Never.
No matter. I doubt it would endear me to the man anyway.
Squash the pretense, Duke.
You don't mean that.
I'm afraid that's impossible. Habits are very hard to break.
If you ever need anything on Alderaan, well, you know the rest. Goodbye to you.
So, where do things stand in your search for Jaesa Willsaam's parents?
It won't be long before I find them.
I'm closing in.
Good to hear.
Don't be nosey.
You cut me to the quick; your purpose is my purpose.
I have to storm Castle Organa.
I have a mission to do.
I see. Well, be sure to meditate, or whatever you Sith do to focus your powers. Castle Organa is tight as a drum.
I must defend the Organa front from an Ulgo attack.
I still have a mission to do.
How miserably unfortunate. Still, we are at war with Ulgo as well as Organa, so it's still within Imperial interests.
They await me at Gesselle's headquarters.
I'm about to get them.
I see. So you got the general to help you. Well done.
Ah well, good luck in your endeavors. I am here if and when you need me.
Ah, back from exploding the Alderaan power generator! I'm so glad you were able to pull that off. So glad!
